author: Business Today Editorial
title: Govt Not Changing The Deadline For Social Media Licensing
text:
The government remains firm in its stance to implement a regulatory or licensing framework for social media and internet messaging services on Jan 1 next year, said Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil.
He said licensing social media platforms is essential to address various internet-related issues, including cyberbullying.
“On the cyberbullying issue, we notice that much of the activity is currently centred on several platforms, particularly Facebook, TikTok and Instagram…this is one reason we stand by the Jan 1, 2025, to implement the licensing system for these social media platforms,” he told a press conference today.
On July 27, the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission announced that all social media and internet messaging services with at least eight million registered users in Malaysia must apply for an Applications Service Providers Class [ASP(C)] Licence under the Communications and Multimedia Act 1998 (Act 588) starting Jan 1, 2025.
Failure to obtain a licence after the effective date will constitute an offence, and appropriate legal action may be taken under Act 588.

author: Enrique Delgado
title: VIDEO así fue el tiroteo en La Casa de la Costilla que dejó 4 heridos y un muerto | El Heraldo de México
text: El restaurante La Casa de la Costilla, ubicado en la colonia Agrícola Oriental, de la alcaldía [Iztacalco](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/6/10/lluvias-crean-enorme-socavon-en-la-agricola-oriental-iztacalco-611103.html), registró un tiroteo el pasado miércoles 12 de junio, alrededor de las 17:00 horas, cuando un grupo de sicarios llegó al establecimiento para abrir fuego contra los asistentes. Las detonaciones prendieron la alarma entre los comensales, quienes se olvidaron de sus platillos y corrieron para alejarse del intercambio de balas lo antes posible. Los momentos de terror que vivieron los asistentes fueron captados por una cámara de videovigilancia, material que fue compartido por el periodista Carlos Jiménez, quien dio a conocer que el suceso dejó un saldo de cuatro heridos y un muerto. Sigue leyendo: [IMÁGENES FUERTES: explota moto bomba y deja al menos a 12 personas quemadas](http://IMÁGENES FUERTES: explota moto bomba y deja al menos a 12 personas quemadas) [IMÁGENES DE IMPACTO: los últimos momentos del empresario fallecido en el tratamiento estético](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/mundo/2024/6/13/imagenes-de-impacto-los-ultimos-momentos-del-empresario-fallecido-en-el-tratamiento-estetico-612146.html) [VIDEO ](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/tv.html)momento exacto de la balacera en La Casa de la Costilla En base a lo que se puede observar en las imágenes que circulan en la plataforma de X, también habían menores de edad presentes durante el ataque armado, quienes se encuentran acompañados de sus padres o tutores mientras escapan de las detonaciones. Incluso, uno de ellos sale huyendo despavorido sin esperar a sus acompañantes. El video también revela el momento exacto en que elementos de la Secretaría de Seguridad Ciudadana (SSC) llegan para contrarrestar el ataque de los delincuentes, sin embargo, ellos abordan motocicletas y emprenden su huida. Por su parte, los uniformados apuntan con sus armas para detener a los agresores y posteriormente atender a los afectados. La zona fue acordonada por los efectivos de la SSC, la cual dio a conocer a través de un comunicado sobre la detención de un masculino involucrado en el ataque. En tanto, personal del Servicio Médico Forense llegó a la escena para llevar a cabo el levantamiento del occiso y realizar las pesquisas para la carpeta de investigación. Los servicios de emergencia llegaron a la escena después de concluyó la balacera con el fin de atender a los clientes heridos. Uno de ellos, un hombre de aproximadamente 45 años de edad, ya no contaba con signos vitales. El resto de las víctimas fueron trasladadas a distintos centros médicos de la Ciudad de México. El resutar

author: Staff
title: Tech-Driven Black Founders Bring AI Creator Tools to the Culture
text:
Nationwide — Trey Young and Preston Weaver, the founders of Blankit Media, a Black-owned, next-generation entertainment company powered by generative AI, are developing tools that empower creators to build, manage, and monetize their own AI-powered virtual influencers. The company has launched a Regulation Crowdfunding (Reg CF) campaign on StartEngine to raise capital for the continued development of its proprietary AI toolset.
Blankit Media’s AI systems integrate generative video, synthetic voice, and animated character technology, enabling creators to generate original content for their virtual influencers and distribute it across platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts. The company’s goal is to streamline content creation and publishing while helping creators retain full ownership of their intellectual property.
“We want to give creators superpowers,” said Trey Young, Co-Founder and CEO of Blankit Media. “We’re building tools that let anyone create their own AI influencer, test content in real time, and compete at the level of a full media studio.”
The company’s creator-led content attracted over 66 million views last quarter alone, demonstrating strong engagement and monetization potential. The new funding will support Blankit Media’s transition to a fully AI-powered production model capable of launching original video series, forming branded character partnerships, and licensing animated influencer IP.
Proceeds from the Reg CF campaign will be used to:
• Expand proprietary AI video and voice generation tools
• Launch original AI-native video series and characters
• Build branded content and licensing partnerships
• Scale publishing across monetized short-form platforms
• Accelerate trend testing and performance optimization through automation
About the Founders
Trey Young, Co-Founder and CEO, is a serial entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience across media, music, and influencer marketing. He launched his first company at 18 and has led ventures that have generated more than 100 million views across digital platforms.
Preston Weaver, Co-Founder and CFO, brings 12 years of experience in financial strategy and five years in media operations. He focuses on building scalable systems that turn AI-powered media into a sustainable, high-growth business.
As two young Black cousins and entrepreneurs from Atlanta, Trey and Preston are building Blankit Media to reshape the future of content creation, making cutting-edge media tools accessible to creators from all backgrounds.
The crowdfunding campaign is now live and open to both accredited and non-accredited investors.
Learn more or invest: StartEngine.com/blankit-media
For press inquiries, contact info@blankitmeida.com or (678) 572-3617
